content.text:
[cron:4ff554e8-042b-4d29-b163-3c1486f6f6a4 Session Health Check] Run session health check to auto-fix bloated/corrupted sessions:

```bash
bash ~/.openclaw/workspace/scripts/session-health-check.sh
```

The script NOW auto-fixes:
1. Transcript files >1MB ‚Üí backed up and cleared
2. Sessions with >60k tokens ‚Üí backed up and reset
3. Corrupted sessions.json ‚Üí recreated
4. Invalid/null sessions ‚Üí removed

If output contains 'FIXES_APPLIED', summarize what was fixed and send a brief note to Alex (+972544419002) via message tool.

If output contains 'ISSUES_FOUND' (warnings only, no fixes), just log it and stay silent.

If no issues at all, output HEARTBEAT_OK.
Current time: Monday, February 9th, 2026 ‚Äî 9:13 AM (Asia/Jerusalem)

content.thinking:
The user wants me to run a session health check script. This is a cron job that checks for bloated/corrupted sessions and auto-fixes them.

Let me run the script and see what happens.

content.thinking:
The script found issues and applied fixes:
1. The "fast" agent's session for the playing group (120363405143589138@g.us) was bloated with 64045 tokens and got auto-reset
2. There was a transcript file with 7 consecutive API errors that got auto-reset (but couldn't find the session key for it)

The output contains evidence of fixes being applied (AUTO-RESETTING messages), so I should notify Alex with a brief summary using the message tool.
